course.subject: IEDA
course.name: Product Design
course.description: Fundamentals of product design from an industrial engineering perspective, including market research and communication, process design and evaluation, design for manufacturability/assembly, design for usability and safety, aesthetics design, and design for reuse. Methods and theories of design and case studies are presented.

reviews.author: yuma
reviews.comment_content:
Very interesting course.

1 lecture (2hrs) and 1 lab (3hrs) in each week

lectures:
mostly covered some design process and marketing stuffs.
Lots of interesting theories and examples, not boring at all.
Some in-class sketching will be provided.
iPRS for EVERY single class

Labs:
Professor will teach some basic sketching and drawing skills in the first 2-3 weeks.
After that it's all about Rhino (3D printing and drawings)
very good course to learn 3d printing
reviews.comment_teaching:
Both the professor and TAs are nice and helpful.
Classes are arranged and taught well.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mostly depend on the final project, where you have to work in groups and design an innovative product.

iPRS,
20+ free-hand sketches,
3 Rhino printing assignments,
1 presentation,
all accounts for certain percentages, overall grading is good
reviews.comment_workload:
in total 20+ sketching exercises

1 Rhino lab exercise EVERY week (which takes maybe 10 hours each)

iPRS quiz at the first 10~15 minutes in EVERY lesson, 10 MC questions about previous lesson.

One simple project


Overall,
one of the largest workload course i have taken, it's pretty fun to me though. If you are interested in product design and have enough time, this is a must-take course.

reviews.comment_content:

Pretty useful I would say, although many disagreed with the use of Rhino.
reviews.comment_teaching:
TAs: LIU, MingYu and WANG, YuQian

The lectures were definitely not boring. The professor tries his best to be interactive and keep the lectures informal.

The TAs are very helpful. You can contact them any time and they'll try to help you out with most things (they even helped me find materials for the project and where to modify them).
reviews.comment_grading:
15% : PRS Quiz
15% : Sketchbook
30% : Labs and Presentations
40% : Project

There will be a PRS Quiz at the start of each lecture (basically like their own way of taking attendance, and also test what you learnt from the previous class in place of exams). Some of the questions may be a little tricky.

Sketchbook: you'll be asked to get a sketchbook, some pencils and a thin pen. You'll be given several sketchbook exercises throughout the semester, which you have to finish in class or at home. Sketchbooks will be collected at the end of the semester (and also once at the start).

Labs and presentations
For a few consecutive weeks, you'll be given a 3D design 'project' where you'll design a balloon car, a drone and a bicycle/dicycle. You'll be given 1-2 weeks to finish each design, which you'll submit through canvas for the TAs to 3D print. The 3D printed product will be handed to you in a week for you to clean and assemble as you wish before you hand in the final product.
Product evaluation presentation: compare and contrast products made for the same purpose (ex: graters, spoons).

Project
The project is about creating/modifying a new/existing product (your product should not already exist). You'll write a proposal for your product after the professor approved the product. You'll then have to create the product using whatever material you want (you will be reimbursed a certain amount, mine was up to 500HKD). You'll then present your product to the rest of the class on 'product exhibition day' (last day of class), where everyone will grade your product and try them. Afterwards, you'll be asked to write a project report.

My PRS were around mean or only slightly above mean on average. My product evaluation presentation was below mean (don't try to do it the night before when you have 2 consecutive morning classes before the presentation day (: ). I did pretty well in the 3D printing (all well above mean). The scores for my sketchbook and project were not published.
Final score: B+
reviews.comment_workload:
PRS Quiz every week at the start of each lecture class
Sketches
3D printing design and assembly
Presentation

Not so bad, but probably not  very easy to do when you also have lots of other classes with non-light workload. :)
